result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrone F. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Allowed Early Discharge after 6 months if all conditions are met. 
Submit a DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyrone F. Brown

records.addlTxt: Count 1 - Probation

9:00 a.m. Court calls the cases. 
Defendant Tyrone F. Brown in court with Attorney (Atty) Karl Alexander Schmidt. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kristian Mukoski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CM112, 15CF168, 15CF362, 17CF480, 18CF192

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF362 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
15CF362 Count 2 - GUILTY
15CM112 - GUILTY
18CF192 Count 2 - GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of the following:
15CF362 Count 1 - Child Abuse
15CF362 Count 2 - Bailjumping
15CM112 - Battery
18CF192 Count 2 - Bailjumping
Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Convictions this date.

The following are dismissed and read-in: 
15CF362 Counts 3, 4 & 5
18CF192 Count 1
15CF168 in its entirety
17CF480 in its entirety

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes. Victims are not present.  
Atty Mukoski indicates none of the victims have requested to make statements and no restitution is being requested. 
Atty Mukoski makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Schmidt makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
 Asks that the balance of the bond that was posted be returned to the poster.  Believes there is jail credit of 170 days on 18CF192 only. 
Atty Mukoski agrees to the jail credit as stated by Atty Schmidt. 

BY THE COURT:
15CF362 Counts 1 & 2 - 
5 years prison with 2 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years Extended Supervision on each count - STAYED -
Count 2 is concurrent with Count 1. 
Not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Programs. 
Placed on probation for a period of 3 years: 
Comply with all conditions ordered in 15CF131. 
No abusive contact with A.B.J. 
No contact with Michelle Deates unless approved by the agent and with the consent of Ms. Deates. 
Comply with other assessments and counseling as recommended by the agent. 
No contact with Josiah Mays. 
Pay costs and surcharges. 
Submit a DNA sample. 

15CM112 - 
30 days jail - STAYED - 
Placed on probation for a period of 1 year:
Pay costs and surcharges. 
Allowed Early Discharge after 6 months if all conditions are met. 
Submit a DNA sample. 

18CF192 Count 2 - 
5 years prison with 2 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years Extended Supervision - STAYED -
171 days credit.
Not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Programs. 
Placed on probation for a period of 3 years: 
Comply with all conditions ordered in 15CF131 and 15CF362.
Pay costs and surcharges. 
Submit a DNA sample. 

Atty Schmidt indicates credit should be 171 days since he had counted 30 days in July rather than 31. 
BY THE COURT:  So ordered. 

Court provides the defendant with a copy of the written explanation of determinate sentence. 
Atty Schmidt is to go over the appeal rights with the defendant.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 10, 2019 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Tyrone F. Brown in court with Attorney (Atty) Karl Alexander Schmidt. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kristian Mukoski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CF-168, 15CF-362, 15CM-112, 17CF-480 and 18CF-192.

8:46 AM Court calls cases. 
Atty Mukoski states appearances.

Atty Mukoski statest these was set for a motion hearing this morning but the parties have reached an agreement on all the cases and wish to have a plea and sentencing hearing set.
Neither party are requesting a presentence investigation.

Parties discuss dates.

Defense requests to withdraw the speedy demand at this time.
Jury trials will be taken off the calendar.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 10, 2019 at 09:00 am.
Motion Hearing set for 12/04/18 - moved, left no address
Motion hearing on December 4, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Pre-Trial Conference set for 11/19/18 and Jury Trial set for 01/09/19 - moved, left no address

Pre-trial conference on November 19, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on January 9, 2019 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyrone F. Brown in court with Attorney (Atty) Karl Alexander Schmidt. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kristian Mukoski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is in custody.
Cases heard at this time are 15CM-112 (status conference), 17CF-480 (status conference), 15CF-362 (status conference), 15CF-168 (status conference) and 18CF-192 (motion to suppress).

3:09 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Mukoski states appearances.

Atty Schmidt has filed a motion to suppress along with affidavit and two exhibits.
Court has reviewed these.

Atty Schmidt addresses the Court, this is a motion to dismiss Count 1 in 18CF-192, rather than a motion to suppress, explains further.
Court questions Atty Schmidt throughout, for clarifications.

Atty Mukoski addresses the Court, requests the Court to deny this motion, for reasons stated on the record.

Atty Schmidt replies to the State's comments and witness intimidation.

Court addresses the parties, has reviewed the preliminary hearing transcript.
Court continues to find today there is probable cause.

BY THE COURT:
Defendant's motion to dismiss Count 1 is denied.

Court addresses further as to Count 1. 

Atty Schmidt files a demand for speedy trial in this case. 
Court will set matter for trial.

Parties are to provide the Court with jury instructions by November 30th.
All motions are to be filed by end of the day on November 16th.

Atty Schmidt addresses the Court as to a bond modification in 18CF-192.
Court replies.

Atty Mukoski addresses the Court, orginal bond is appropriate for reasons stated on the record. 

Atty Schmidt addresses the Court, his client is on 3 years probation.

Court addresses the parties.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders bond amended.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 19, 2018 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2019 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyrone F. Brown in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CF105, 15CF131, 15CF168, 15CF362 and 15CM112.

11:07 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Court makes statements to the defendant.
Court questions the defendant.
Atty Knaapen makes statements.  

BY THE COURT:
Attorney is discharged by the Order of the Court for his failure to appear for his client.
Defendant is to go to the Public Defender's Office and get new representation.
Bond and conditions of bond are continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Tyrone F. Brown not in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CF105, 15CF131, 15CF168, 15CF362, 15CM112

Atty Knaapen indicates he received a call from Atty Templeton indicating he had car trouble.  

Court will set for a pre-trial conference.  Informs the clerk to add to the notice "If defendant fails to appear, a warrant will be issued."  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Record Update
Atty David Templeton appointed
Order allowing Atty Anne Renc to withdraw as counsel for the defendant /s/ TTF 04/26/16
Pre-trial conference on May 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Tyrone F. Brown in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-105, 15CF-131, 15CF-168, 15CF-362 and 15CM-112.

1:22 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

These are before the Court on a motion to withdraw on this case.
Atty Renc addresses the Court regarding her request.

Atty Renc has been the first attorney on this case, in light of Defendant's uncomfortableness, it is prudent for Atty Renc to withdraw. Atty Renc understands the jury trial will not go tomorrow. There is a speedy trial demand on another case for jury trial tomorrow.

Court questions Defendant.
Defendant addresses the Court regarding his request for another attorney, lack of communication.
Atty Renc replies.

Discussions continue.

15CF-105 is the oldest of these cases.
Address is verified.

BY THE COURT:
Based on record that's been made today, will allow Atty Renc to withdraw as counsel on all of these files.

State is not taking a position in this case.

**Clerk put a signed copy of all the orders in each file**

BY THE COURT:
Bond and conditions of bond are ordered continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.
